Schedule

Events

Participate in the many workshops, meet-ups, exhibitions and learn from other professionals in the coworking community who will share their knowledge around topics like technology, marketing, business operations, community building, and more. Meet new friends, potential partners and make meaningful connections. Details will be in the schedule below.

Tour & Explore

Learn more about a space through an organized tour. Each space is unique, the amenities vary, and each community is different. Check out a space near you and join a tour. See Tours for details.

09:30am - 11:00am

St. Oberholz

Press Breakfast: Status Quo of Coworking in Berlin

What about coworking in Berlin? What do you need to know about the Berlin coworking scene that is not in any WeWork, Mindspace & Co. press release? We have invited three extremely prominent and, above all, very experienced coworking experts as guests, who will be available to answer questions from the invited media. We are pleased that the following guests are taking part in the press breakfast:

‚Äì Madeleine Gummer von Mohl, co-founder and CEO of betahaus
‚Äì Ansgar Oberholz, co-founder and CEO of St. Oberholz
‚Äì Carsten Foertsch, co-founder and CEO of deskmag

The podium will be moderated by Johanna Voll, coworking researcher at Viadrina University and member of the board of the German Coworking Federation.

As befits the St. Oberholz, of course not only people with a press card are invited, but all publishers of Berlin. :-)

10:00am - 02:00pm

betahaus | pop up

At our WorkParty, enjoy coworking and networking activities spiced up by short group breaks for sharing and socialising. Bring your most difficult tasks and use the productive vibe to get your work done, meet a bunch of professionals in Berlin and see what coworking is all about!

08:00pm - 09:30pm

St. Oberholz

Out Of Berlin: Coworking in Brandenburg

Coworking has long since ceased to be something reserved for urban space. In recent years, the idea of working together has also penetrated the countryside. We invited our neighbours to come to Rosenthaler Platz for an exchange and won some pioneers of coworking in Brandenburg. We are looking forward to the following guests:

‚Äì Torsten Kohn from the "Old School" in Letschin
‚Äì Antonia Polkehn from the "Blok-O" in Frankfurt (Oder)
‚Äì Matthias Noack from the "MietWerk" in Potsdam
‚Äì Janosch Dietrich from the "Coconat" in Bad Belzig

The panel discussion will be moderated by Tobias Kremkau, coworking manager at St. Oberholz and author of the Netzpiloten column "Neue Provinz".

We are looking forward to guests from near and far, especially of course from all corners of Brandenburg, but also from Berlin, who are interested in coworking.

KinkyWork Coworking

Fill up your Instagram at KinkyWork

KinkyWork is a 700 m2 converted factory loft with coworking desks, a photo studio and street art. Our members love to bring their kinky spirit to work. Experience professional productivity and uncompromising creativity, count our 215 windows and discover unique backdrops for selfies and stories. Bring your friends along! Coffee and coworking are free for one day.

05:00pm - 07:00pm

Coconat

We are excited to announce a free bookkeeping 101 session with our bookkeeping partner eifas to answer all of your tax and bookkeeping questions.

A lot of entrepreneurs pile up money in their bank accounts to cover the amount they have to pay to the tax authorities at some point. The goal of the evening is to explain basic concepts of entrepreneurial accounting and getting to know the right digital tools that help you manage your finances. Matthias from eifas will be at the event to answer your most burning questions.
Agenda:

- Financial admin and accounting basics
- Reporting and general tax reporting ; liquidity planning
- How mobile work from anywhere in the world and bookkeeping on the go make your daily work life easier
- How the digitalisation of accounting and a digital tax office optimises your administrative processes
- Questions

Hosted with Eifas

Free Childcare available, please email julianne@coconat-space.com

Coworking costs nothing that day and everyone can find out for themselves what it's like to work in a coworking space. Is there a better place than the caf√© where everything started with coworking? We don't believe it and look forward to your visit.

06:30pm - 09:00pm

juggleHUB Coworking

Successful Communication in Heated Phases
Whether in private or professional life: Communication can get complicated when difficult topics are discussed that cause feelings to get hurt or individual needs to be disregarded.

In the 2,5 hour workshop you will learn
- how to give critical feedback in a respectful manner
- how to react to critical feedback in a relaxed manner
- how to stay calm in emotional situations

Besides touching on brief theoretical excerpts on modern communication models, the focus will be mainly on practical excercises.

08:00pm - 09:30pm

St. Oberholz

Panel discussion: Women in Coworking

The coworking market is pushing into more and more niches, one of which is targetinf just over half the world's population. There are about 3.85 billion women in the world, but only a few coworking spaces exclusively for women and people who identify themselves as non-binary. At the same time, it seems that in recent years most coworking spaces in Germany have been founded by women, if you look at the minds behind the latest start-ups. We are therefore looking forward to talking to founders of Coworking Spaces in Berlin and Brandenburg. So far the following guests have agreed:

‚Äì Katja Thiede, co-founder and CEO of the juggleHUB
‚Äì Julianne Becker, co-founder and CEO of Coconat
‚Äì further speakers are requested

The panel discussion will be moderated by Katy Z√ºhlke, head of project management at St. Oberholz and member of the board of the German Coworking Federation.

We are looking forward to guests with X- and Y-chromosomes who are interested in coworking. The event will be held mainly in English.

06:30pm - 08:30pm

Ahoy Berlin

Future Of Work: The Modern-Day Freelancer

Freelancing isn't a fad, it's here to stay - but while you support yourself, who's supporting you?

In conjunction with the Berlin Coworking Festival, CodeControl & Vantik are taking this unique opportunity to explain just how they have created a much-needed support system for freelancers all over the world.

CodeControl is a vetted community of 400 freelance developers, designers, and product managers. It's a one-stop shop for finding awesome gigs, growing your network, always getting paid on time, and so much more.

Vantik is a retirement account for the independent. It's the first private pension fund that is tailored entirely to your needs - with all the transparency and flexibility you'd expect to have.

The event will be moderated by Miryana from Ahoy Berlin and the speakers from CodeControl & Vantik will be Tristan and Lara, respectively.

Big thank you to Ahoy Berlin for hosting!

03:00pm - 04:30pm

St. Oberholz

Friday Afternoon Coffee: Rural Coworking

The most intensively discussed topic in the coworking scene at the moment is development in rural areas. More and more coworking spaces are being founded in small towns and villages, far away from Rosenthaler Platz and the logic of land use that real estate companies such as WeWork, Mindspace & Co. that only use the term coworking need in order to exist. In the countryside there is still the luxury of emptiness and people's need for spaces like coworking spaces is driven by values instead of profit. We are therefore looking for an exchange on this topic with people who deal with rural development and are looking forward to the following guests:

- Mareike Meyn, Researcher at Andreas Hermes Academy
- Silvia Hennig, Founder & CEO of Neuland 21
- Philipp Hentschel, Founder & CEO of welance

The panel discussion will be moderated by Tobias Kremkau, coworking manager at St. Oberholz and author of the Netzpiloten column "New Province".

04:00pm - 06:00pm
